critique: This executive order pertains to the transfer of commissioned officers of the Coast and Geodetic Survey to the War or Navy Department during a national emergency (World War II). It outlines the conditions of their service and return. There's no direct indication of ideological leaning (liberal vs. conservative), immigration policy, or social inclusion. It does expand executive power to some extent by authorizing these transfers during a national emergency. It also centralizes control at the federal level, as it involves federal departments. The order seems to prioritize national security during wartime. There's no direct impact on economic regulation. Therefore, the initial scores are as follows:
